title: mremoteNG quit sundenly on remote desktop machine
author: vupv
body_snippet:
Hi Support

I got an issued when working on mRemoteNG on remote desktop machine, It was quit sudnenly and I get error in windows application log

Faulting application name: mRemoteNG.exe, version: 1.76.20.24615, time stamp: 0x5cb09552
Faulting module name: mstscax.dll, version: 10.0.18362.449, time stamp: 0xfa706577
Exception code: 0xc0000005
Fault offset: 0x005be81b
Faulting process id: 0x1638
Faulting application start time: 0x01d64aa0f790c06f
Faulting application path: C:\Program Fi...

iterations.description: Issue body is empty with no crash log, stack trace, or reproduction steps; 'quit suddenly on remote desktop machine' is too vague to diagnose without knowing if it's an unhandled exception, RDP session disconnect event, or rendering issue.

comments.author: farosch
comments.snippet:
This error was thrown in the `mstscax.dll`.
As you failed to fill out the issue template and inform us about the versions of windows your guest/host are running and what version of mRemoteNG you are using I'll go with this:
Update your OS

Will reopen this whenever you provide some real information.

comments.author: farosch
comments.snippet:
@vupv Does the error still appear when you replace your _mstscax.dll_ with the one below??

[mstscax.zip](https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/files/4975967/mstscax.zip)


EDIT:
This dll comes from my system (Windows 10 2004 build 19041.207) and is version 10.0.19041.153, so it's slightly newer than the one on your system (10.0.18362.449).
You can find that dll in _C:\windows\system32_ . Just rename the original one to something else (e.g. add .orig to the filename) and put the one from...

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet: Triage refresh (P2): this issue has been inactive for a long time. Please retest on the latest build and share reproducible steps, expected vs actual behavior, and logs/screenshots. If there is no confirmation/update, maintainers can close it as stale or not reproducible.

notes:
AI triage (claude): Issue body is empty with no crash log, stack trace, or reproduction steps; 'quit suddenly on remote desktop machine' is too vague to diagnose without knowing if it's an unhandled exception, RDP session disconnect event, or rendering issue.
Approach: Request crash log from %APPDATA%\mRemoteNG\mRemoteNG.log and steps to reproduce (OS version, RDP client version, connection type being used when crash occurs)
